area_name: Box Prarie Boulders and Climbs-Dragon Scales Rock

content.description: 20 foot slab, excellent for new climbers to smear/edge on, easy top out.
content.location: 40-50 yards up the gully east of the parking lot area boulders.

content.description: Left route. 5.8 crux at last moves to the top. Go just right of a loose, hollow flake.  Harder if your short.  Right route-5.5- take wall up 6 feet right of Left route.
content.location:
30 yards up hill north of

Gray Havens boulder

.  Wall sticks up out of trees, very sunny.

content.description: 5 problems from left to right.  #1.  Overhanging prow.  #2.  overhanging traverse out prow. ( I have not climbed 1 or 2, the rock needs cleaned.  Feeling the holds and hanging on them they feel V-2/3ish)#3.  left side of face just right of prow 5.6  #4.  Middle of face 5.10, tricky top out.  #5.  10+/11a sit start on far right side of rock.
content.location: 20 or thirty yards south east of Dome on east end of parking lot.

content.description: Pull bulge at beginning (5.8) and slab up to overlap.  Get in a cam and step up onto upper slab (scale).  No pro for the next 35 feet.  Slab and edge up the left side of the scale to a stance. Finish with the slanting, fist crack and slab on the right.
content.protection: A couple of cams 3/4 to 1 1/2 and a 3 inch cam or two for the finishing crack.
content.location: Near the west end of a series of overlapping slabs on Dragon Scale Rock.

content.description: #1.  Left side up ledgy arete 5.7.  # 2Face just right of arete 5.8.  #3. ** The Leaper -V-2- Middle of face, small pine growing 9 feet up. Grab a white blob of granite to get on the rock. undercling crack and throw for the rail 4 1/2 feet up the dead vertical face.  #4.** We be Jammin- 5.10 - right side of boulder- jam the horizontal crack and throw 4 feet to rail.
content.protection: Crash pad, soft pine needles on ground.
content.location: Up hill and left of the blob ( north of parking lot).  A solid orange and gray face 15 feet tall with a horizontal crack on the right side 4 feet off the ground.

content.description: Left route edges up thin bumps, V-1.  Easy top out. Right route takes a painful finger crimper.  V-2, first or second move depending on how you do it. Very fun routes that require excellent foot work.  Easy top out.
content.location: Up the gully 50-60 yards from the parking area.  A grey diamond-shaped wall, south-facing, in the shade. Just past a boggy area.

content.description: Start at overlap under a shrub.  Pull the overlap and slab up the left edge placing gear where you can (slim).  Crux is 1/2 up.
content.location: Park at the dirt pullout on the Forest Service Road 100 just prior to a gate 100 yards or so from County Road 44H.  Hike uphill across road for 75 yards to Dragon Scales Rock.

content.description: Start in a small alcove above a short 4th class section.  Step onto face and go left to arete and first bolt, then up.  Crux is gaining the bulge at the third bolt. Easy edging up left side of blunt arete to underclings under the bulge.  Poor feet on small crimps,  Look for a hidden smear under the edge of the bluge for your feet to get you through the crux.  Very fun and airy.
content.protection: 4 bolts with supplemental cams 1/2" to 1 1/2".  Walk of or rap off of two bolts.
content.location: Route is the north west edge of the formation of Dragon Scales Rocks.  High point of the crag with a prominent, left-arching roof that intersects the arete. Easily seen from Forest Service Road 100.  Gain the start of the route by 4th classing up a short section to the base.

content.description: A solid, dome-shaped rock with a V2, slabby route on the far left and a fun, slopey crack on the far right (5.9).  There are 3 routes in between (5.7 to 5.10).
content.location: Dome shaped rock immediatly east of the far end of the parking lot.  A small aspen tree separates routes 1 and 2 from routes 3 and 4.  # 5 is up around the to the right 20 feet or so.

content.description:
Start in a small alcove in the center of the face, same start as for dragon slayer, but go up and right to the left-arching crack/roof.  Gain the crack and climb up and left underclinging with good feet and continue to arete.  Finish with the 10d bulge on

Dragon Slayer

.  Fun, easy crack with a hard finish.
content.protection: Nuts and cams 1/2" to 1 1/2".  One of my HBs is in the crack now. 2 bolts at crux and finish.  Two bolt anchor or walk off.
content.location: Upper north west end of Dragon Scales Rocks.  High point of immediate crag easily seen from Forest Service Road 100.  Clean face with prominent, left-slanting roof/crack.

content.description: Up hill from the Dome and Prow, maybe 50 yards.  A blob of rock with an overhanging right side.  Easy top outs.  From right to left.  #1.  5.8ish up blob on right.  #2.  Short face with one or two perfect fist jams, 5.7.  #3.  5.7 face on left with a finger lock to get you up.
content.location: Walk off top.  Rounded blob on right side.

pathTokens: Box Prarie Boulders and Climbs-Dragon Scales Rock
